item.title: Tool tip: Tippecanoe Command Generator
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: If you create, or are curious about, #VectorTiles, you may have come across the command line utility #Tippecanoe (TIP-ə-kə-NOO). It’s probably no secret that its usage is not entirely trivial, but there is a helpful tool for this now.

item.title: Open SAR data
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Synthetic Aperture Radar (#SAR) is an interesting #remotesensing technology that captures high-resolution data of the Earth’s surface, regardless of weather or lighting conditions. This curated collection of open SAR data sources provides an excellent starting point for exploring this powerful technology, whether for research, experimentation, or practical applications.

item.title: New map viewer for the canton of Aargau
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: A few days ago, the Canton of #Aargau unveiled its new browser-based map viewer, built using #OpenLayers and #React.

item.title: The origins of GIScience in Switzerland with Rob Weibel
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Robert Weibel, Professor of Geographic Information Science at the University of Zurich, retired at the end of January 2025 after a distinguished career spanning over three decades. In an interview, Rob reflects on the remarkable evolution of Geographic Information Science, from its early days to its current status as a widely accepted scientific sub-discipline of geography.

item.title: Open doors at swisstopo
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: The Federal Office of Topography #swisstopo is opening its doors to the public on May 24.

item.title: Why cloud-native?
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Kyle Barron, cloud engineer at Development Seed and developer of Lonboard, offers interesting insights into the cloudnativegeo paradigm in a recent interview with CNG. He discusses Parquet, GeoParquet, and GeoArrow, explaining their characteristics and potential to significantly improve geospatial data handling.

item.title: GeoAI: State-of-play in 2025
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: The Innovation Booster #ArtificialIntelligence has released a concise review of #GeoAI in Switzerland. The report highlights significant players, innovations, and developments in the field, showcasing how #AI is being integrated into #GIS applications by established providers and startups alike. It further identifies three main areas where AI is currently being applied in GIS.

item.title: Labeling master class
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: From cartographer Andy Skinner comes this very useful resource about #labels in #cartography for both interactive and static #maps. Scale, transparency-and-opacity, hue, tone, halos, … – this guide covers many different visual variables and how they can be used to make the information in a map easier to grasp.

item.title: Best practices for Cloud-Optimized GeoTIFFs
item.dc:creator: David Oesch
item.description: Cloud-Optimized #GeoTIFFs (#COG-s) have revolutionized the way large geospatial raster datasets are accessed and processed. From GeoStandards comes Best Practices Guide for this #cloudnativegeo format.

item.title: Open data at a glance
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: #ASIT has published an #opendata guide for #geodata. The guide covers the essentials and strikes a very nice balance with respect to covering the topic in enough depth to be valuable, while not being trivial and also not covering every tiny detail. Recommended reading for anybody interested in open data!

item.title: EMBAG/LMETA does not make open geodata
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: The #EMBAG or #LMETA, a Swiss federal law enacted at the start of 2024 mandates #OpenData. But there seems to be a confusion about its effects on geoinformation.

item.title: Google and Esri collaboration in 3D
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: #Google and #Esri have agreed on a collaboration that will bring photorealistic #3D data from Google Maps into the #ArcGIS ecosystem, starting in fall.

item.title: Going forward, maps for AI
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Here’s a big geospatial #AI wager: #Niantic, maker of AR game Pokémon Go among others, has announced that Scopely will acquire its game business and that Niantic will be spinning out a new geospatial #AI company, Niantic Spatial Inc.

item.title: Central nodes* in geospatial
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Few weeks ago, Brian Monheiser has issued this call on LinkedIn: Who are the top 10 living geospatial thought leaders whose insights you prioritize, whose talks you never miss, and whose writings you always read?

item.title: 25 years Shuttle Radar Topography Mission
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: It’s the 25th anniversary of the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM)! This mission revolutionized Earth observation by creating the first near-global high-resolution digital elevation model. A look back on this fantastic achievement.

item.title: Tool tip: Navigating the maze of coordinate reference systems
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Many people struggle with coordinate reference systems (#CRSs). Who can blame them? But there is a tool that can help you out if you find yourself experiencing the same predicament.

item.title: #cloudnativegeo: Approachable
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: There is considerable technical writing around #cloudnativegeo data formats. For a more accessible introduction, check out the ‘Optimizing Geospatial for the Cloud’ zine by #DevelopmentSeed which uses storytelling to break down technical barriers.

item.title: Office for Geoinformation Canton Thurgau on LinkedIn
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Starting today, the Office for #Geoinformation of the Canton of #Thurgau has a #LinkedIn account. This made me wonder, how many other cantonal geoinformation offices have a similar presence.

item.title: GeoParquet to come to Esri ArcGIS Pro
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: #cloudnativegeo and #GeoParquet news: Chris Holmes shares that the status of a petition for GeoParquet support in #Esri #ArcGIS Pro has changed to “In product plan”.

item.title: Toponyms
item.dc:creator: Ralph Straumann
item.description: Weekend diversion: Mapmakers (or their financers) got to name a lot of places. There’s a website and a Mastodon account that makes it its purpose to surface the sometimes odd and sometimes funny toponyms …
